menu.title: RegressionLab
menu.welcome: Welcome, scientist. What would you like to do?
menu.tooltip_normal_fitting: Fit one equation to a single dataset.
menu.tooltip_multiple_datasets: Fit the same equation to multiple datasets.
menu.tooltip_checker_fitting: Try several equations on the same dataset.
menu.tooltip_total_fitting: Apply all available equations to one dataset.

workflow.loop_help: After the first fit you can upload another file and fit with the same equation.
workflow.loop_refit_caption: Upload another file, choose variables and click the button to fit again.
workflow.multiple_loop_hint: You can upload another set of files and click the button again for another round of fits with the same equation.

error.path_not_file: The specified path is not a file: {path}

help.title: Application information
help.sections_hint: Click a header to expand or collapse its content.
help.objective_description: RegressionLab lets you fit experimental data comfortably, accurately, and quickly, with support for uncertainties and report-ready formatting. It is aimed at experimental physics, sciences, engineering, and computing, and is especially useful for students who need to fit data without programming or as a validation tool.
help.advantage_1: ‚Ä¢ **Simple setup**: Put your data (Excel, CSV or TXT) in a folder, run the app, and get professional plots and formatted results ready to copy into your report.
help.advantage_2: ‚Ä¢ **Fit to known functions**: Fit with predefined or custom functions quickly and directly.
help.advantage_3: ‚Ä¢ **Loop mode**: Add data progressively to your file and refit without reconfiguring each time.
help.advantage_4: ‚Ä¢ **Multiple datasets**: Fit the same equation to several series (e.g. the same experiment on different days) in a systematic way.
help.advantage_5: ‚Ä¢ **Model exploration**: Try several or all functions on the same data to choose the best fit.
help.advantage_6: ‚Ä¢ **Multiple platforms**: Available as a desktop app and web (Streamlit), with no complex installation.
help.advantage_7: ‚Ä¢ **Highly configurable**: Customise colours, plot styles, and fonts via environment variables.
help.advantage_8: ‚Ä¢ **Extensible**: You can add new fitting functions to adapt the application to your needs.
help.advantage_9: ‚Ä¢ **Your own formulas**: Define and fit functions with your own mathematical expression from the interface.
help.custom_functions_how:
Select "Custom formula" as the equation type.
1) Enter each parameter name when prompted (one per dialog).
2) Enter the expression in Python syntax using **x** as the independent variable (e.g. a*x**2 + b*x + c).
Optionally, under "Configure initial parameters" you can set initial values and min‚Äìmax bounds for each parameter.
help.normal_fitting: ‚Ä¢ **Normal fitting**: One equation for a single dataset. The most common mode.
help.multiple_datasets: ‚Ä¢ **Multiple datasets**: The same equation is fitted to several files or series; useful for comparing replicates of the same experiment.
help.checker_fitting: ‚Ä¢ **Multiple functions**: Try different equations on the same dataset to compare models.
help.total_fitting: ‚Ä¢ **All functions**: Applies all available equations to one dataset; useful for exploring which model fits best.
help.loop_mode: ‚Ä¢ **Loop mode**: After each fit you can load another file and refit with the same equation without leaving the application.
help.data_format_named: ‚Ä¢ **Headers required**: First row with column names. One column per quantity and one per uncertainty (if applicable).
help.data_format_u_prefix: ‚Ä¢ **Uncertainties**: Name uncertainty columns with prefix 'u' + variable (e.g. ux, uy).
help.data_input: ‚Ä¢ By default, data files are read from the 'input/' folder. The path can be changed in Configuration.
help.data_formats: ‚Ä¢ Supported formats: .xlsx, .csv, .txt (CSV with comma or semicolon).
help.output_plots: ‚Ä¢ Plots are saved by default in 'output/'. The folder can be changed in Configuration.
help.output_logs: ‚Ä¢ Application log is saved in 'regressionlab.log' (path configurable).
help.r_squared_desc: ‚Ä¢ **R¬≤ (coefficient of determination)**: Proportion of the variance in y explained by the model. Value between 0 and 1; the closer to 1, the better the fit.
help.r_squared_formula: Formula: R¬≤ = 1 ‚àí SS_res/SS_tot, with SS_res = Œ£(y‚àí≈∑)¬≤ and SS_tot = Œ£(y‚àí»≥)¬≤ (≈∑ = fitted value, »≥ = mean of y).
help.rmse_desc: ‚Ä¢ **RMSE (root mean square error)**: Average magnitude of residuals. Lower values indicate better fit; expressed in the same units as the dependent variable.
help.rmse_formula: Formula: RMSE = ‚àö[Œ£(y‚àí≈∑)¬≤/n], with y observed, ≈∑ fitted, and n = number of points.
help.chi_squared_desc: ‚Ä¢ **œá¬≤ (chi-squared)**: Sum of squared residuals weighted by uncertainties. Lower values indicate better fit when uncertainties are well estimated.
help.chi_squared_formula: Formula: œá¬≤ = Œ£ [(y‚àí≈∑)/u_y]¬≤, where u_y is the uncertainty of each y.
help.reduced_chi_squared_desc: ‚Ä¢ **œá¬≤_red (reduced chi-squared)**: œá¬≤ divided by degrees of freedom. A value close to 1 suggests uncertainties are consistent with the fit.
help.dof_desc: ‚Ä¢ **ŒΩ (degrees of freedom)**: Number of points minus number of fitted parameters.
help.dof_formula: Formula: ŒΩ = n ‚àí p (n = points, p = parameters).
help.param_ci_95_desc: ‚Ä¢ **95% CI (95% confidence interval)**: For each parameter, the range within which the true value is expected with 95% confidence (t-distribution).
help.param_ci_95_formula: Calculation: [Œ∏ ‚àí t¬∑œÉ_Œ∏, Œ∏ + t¬∑œÉ_Œ∏], where Œ∏ = parameter, œÉ_Œ∏ = parameter uncertainty, and t = 97.5% percentile of the t-distribution with ŒΩ degrees of freedom.

config.title: Application configuration
config.restart_hint: Changes take effect after restarting the application.
config.desc_LANGUAGE: Application language code: es (Spanish), en (English), de (German).
config.desc_UI_BACKGROUND: Background colour for windows and widgets. E.g. midnight blue, navy, #2C3E50.
config.desc_UI_FOREGROUND: Text colour in the interface. E.g. snow, white.
config.desc_UI_BUTTON_FG: Text colour for action buttons. E.g. lime green.
config.desc_UI_BUTTON_FG_CANCEL: Text colour for Exit and Cancel buttons. E.g. red2.
config.desc_UI_PADDING: Internal spacing in pixels (horizontal and vertical).
config.desc_UI_BUTTON_WIDTH: Width in characters for buttons like Exit or Accept (wide = 2.5√ó this).
config.desc_UI_FONT_SIZE: Interface font size in points (large size = 1.25√ó this).
config.desc_UI_FONT_FAMILY: Font name (e.g. Menlo, Arial). Must be installed.
config.desc_UI_SPINBOX_WIDTH: Width in characters for numeric fields with arrows.
config.desc_UI_ENTRY_WIDTH: Width in characters for text fields.
config.desc_UI_BUTTON_BG: Background color for buttons (slightly different from window background).
config.desc_UI_BUTTON_FG_ACCENT2: Text colour for equation-type buttons. E.g. yellow.
config.desc_UI_TEXT_SELECT_BG: Background colour of selected text. E.g. steel blue.
config.desc_DPI: Dots per inch when saving the plot image.
config.desc_PLOT_SHOW_TITLE: If enabled, the plot title (fit name) is shown.
config.desc_PLOT_LINE_COLOR: Colour of the fit line. E.g. black.
config.desc_PLOT_MARKER_FORMAT: Data point shape: o (circle), s (square), ^ (triangle), d (diamond), * (star).
config.desc_PLOT_ERROR_COLOR: Colour of uncertainty bars. E.g. crimson.
config.desc_FONT_FAMILY: Family: serif, sans-serif, monospace, cursive, fantasy.
config.desc_FONT_TITLE_SIZE: Size: xx-small, x-small, small, medium, large, x-large, xx-large.
config.desc_FONT_TITLE_WEIGHT: Weight: normal, bold, light, semibold, heavy.
config.desc_FILE_INPUT_DIR: Folder where data files are looked for (relative to project).
config.desc_FILE_OUTPUT_DIR: Folder where plots are saved (relative to project).
config.desc_FILE_FILENAME_TEMPLATE: Template for plot filename. Use {} as placeholder for fit name. E.g. fit_{}.
config.desc_FILE_PLOT_FORMAT: Format for saving plots: png, jpg, or pdf.
config.desc_DONATIONS_URL: If set, a donations button appears at the end of the Help window. Leave empty to hide.
config.desc_LOG_LEVEL: Logging level: DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL.
config.desc_LOG_CONSOLE: If enabled, log output is also shown in the console.
